intro: Grammitis sherringii, commonly known as the Sherring's spikemoss, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like appearance. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on rocks or tree trunks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has short, creeping stems with whorled leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of moisture-retaining hairs. It is native to Australia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of undisturbed forest ecosystems.
